website_summaries.verdict: The best budget book on learning Java written for programmers with little-to-no experience.
pros: The book introduces the concept of Java programming from the very start without using unfamiliar terms
Projects follow a step-by-step approach, introducing new concepts in a straightforward manner
cons: The later chapters lack some of the advanced concepts necessary for complex programming

customer_reviews.title: A great guide for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly I am not a computer geek. I know enough to get me by and that's about it, but having website and running into some issues that kept telling me there was a java issue I knew I needed to Learn something about it. This book explained things and help me make sense of it enough that I'm no longer terrified of addressing the issue. Its explained in a way that I could understand which was a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: Book Goddess Leah

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: My wife is an executive for a major corporation, having recently found herself involved with using Java software. I got this book for her, and she absorbed it like wildfire and keeps her kindle on her desk for reference. As an autodidact in the corporate world, she needs every advantage she can get, so thanks to the Author!
customer_reviews.author: Dark Unicorn

customer_reviews.title: An Extremely Helpful Book
customer_reviews.text: I know this book is great for beginner because I am a beginner and this book was a godsend for me. I was working on a project at work in which Java was being used and this book provided the basic understanding that I needed. It is very well written and filled with examples that make it easier for a novice to understand the central concepts. This book was extremely helpful
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Consistently great guidance
customer_reviews.text: I have now worked my way through many of Nathan's books. I really appreciate his style of teaching and how he formats his books. They are easy to go back and reference them when I get struck. I started using his books to refresh my past program lessons. Now I know what I can expect with Nathan's books and have no problem quickly coming up to speed.
customer_reviews.author: Baileyminn

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Do you want to learn Java? Yes? If so, this book is for you! Step by step, it will guide you from the beginning, along several books, until you will know. The whole series of books are very detailed and very organized- Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Yael Manor

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have been interested in Java programming for quite some time now. Nathan's book does a really great job at breaking things down. I have always had a problem with numbers and letters combined together so two read troughs through anything basic having to do with programming is always necessary if not more. I believe just one more read through will be sufficient for this book. It is a really good beginner's book. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey Hill

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what you will get from this book.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: worthless
customer_reviews.text: Really poor, typos everywhere, no minimal checking. I think Amazon should enforce a minimum quality to the books it offers here, even though they are selling for 2 bucks. From now on I won't bother to anything worth less than $15, even for free it's a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Maciel

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good guide for people who want to learn Java. I thought it was the perfect length, and the tables and examples were really helpful. The book is written in a beginner-friendly language that isn't too convoluted and you don't feel overwhelmed. It's worth checking out.
customer_reviews.author: L. Duff

customer_reviews.title: This book was a pleasant surprise ...
customer_reviews.text: We typically buy Dummies books for our studies - decided to try this book for it's content - was pleasantly surprised - well laid out - easy to follow ... well presented overall ...
customer_reviews.author: Canadian Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is just excerpts from the java manual. Nothing is explained. Also very short book. Definitely a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This book was very good and professional
customer_reviews.text: This book was very good and professional. I'm a beginner, so I appreciated the simple but thorough explanation of everything regarded Java programming. I recommend it to everyone who is like me and likes fast, smart learning.
customer_reviews.author: SacredGeometryBlog

customer_reviews.title: An effective way to learn Java!
customer_reviews.text: Core Java is complete, concise and well-written. The comparisons with C++ in the book may be considered unnecessary by some, but I found them to be extremely effective at tying different pieces of knowledge together. If you're a C++ programmer wanting to transition into the realm of Java, this is the perfect book for you.
customer_reviews.author: Susana Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I learned a lot from reading this book! I did not know much about programming before reading this book. Now I can say I feel comfortable with the basic concepts of programming. I definitely recommend you read this book if you are interested in learning about programming it is very helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Anzel E Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Beyond the typos that I found which were confusing, the author doesn't really explain what is going on with the code, the book was not as helpful as I had hoped
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot of really excellent info in this book. I have read several others by Nathan Clark. He publishes great quality stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Edm

customer_reviews.title: Nathan Clark always seems to deliver high quality guides for ...
customer_reviews.text: Nathan Clark always seems to deliver high quality guides for absolute beginners who want to learn programming on their own. His guides are concise, practical, to the point, and this one makes no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: Great book! Great buy! This book is worth the money to spend on the book. I highly recommend this book to others!!
customer_reviews.author: Russell Kershaw

customer_reviews.title: Very basic - mostly about data types
customer_reviews.text: Mostly about data types and uses. Although it wasn't indicated, that I saw, it is part of a series.
customer_reviews.author: N. Koelkebeck

customer_reviews.title: Helps to grasp a basic understanding to simple code
customer_reviews.text: This book should be used while studying from a real java textbook from such authors like Tony Gaddis. The book is pretty expensive but you have the opportunity to gain a lot of practice.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Java beginners and core java learners.Easy and understandable language.Very well explained with examples for each concept.Learnt something out of it.
customer_reviews.author: ARAVIND BOYANI

customer_reviews.title: This book is not good
customer_reviews.text: Cant find what i need java programming in this book
customer_reviews.author: Amar Dotel

customer_reviews.title: Very good! Well written in an easy and  straight forward way!
customer_reviews.text: I really understood every concept because it was so very well explained. I would recommend this book for anyone who wants to learn java!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Dave

customer_reviews.title: Step by step java tutorial
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It really helped me learn java basics
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad Ballouch

customer_reviews.title: Good for absolute beginners
customer_reviews.text: Good book for absolute beginners, not for experienced coders unless they want to brush up on the basics. Take the title for what it is
customer_reviews.author: Josh Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: A better way for easy understanding!
customer_reviews.text: This a great book for beginners who are trying to learn java and wanting to master it in just a short span of time. This book has the enough information on the early implementation of java, what java is and is presently used for. This is fun to read especially because of its beginner-friendly thoughts and techniques. This book is really a great guide for a better understanding about java. Now it's time for an application of this guide which is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Carlson

customer_reviews.title: The best Java basics book!
customer_reviews.text: My son is taking a programming class in high school. I bought this as a supplement to his class and it has completely replaced it. He is ahead of everyone in his class as during his study halls he reads this book. He is quite pleased with it and wants to learn another programming language and we will definitely look at this publisher for that one too!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Very well explained
customer_reviews.text: This book is ideal for use for beginners to learn all the basics of programming. What is Java, it’s features, variables and much more! Well written and full of practical examples that makes learning much easier. I will read trough the book a second time and then keep it as a reference guide while going on to the next book in the series.
customer_reviews.author: Laylah

customer_reviews.title: Great for absolute beginners
customer_reviews.text: Just the right read for first touch with java/programming. Just this book isn’t enough to get you going, you’ll need to purchase next levels, but it is great for intro.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This book says it is for beginners it is not I have created some small easy programs with youtube that worked none of the sample code in this book has worked without an error. I am sure the code is good but other setting must need to be done and I can`t figure it out. I am using eclipse so the book may be ok but it is not for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Learn
customer_reviews.text: I read this on my Kindle with my son in mind. He is taking programming in school. I will definitely pick up a paper copy. It's so easy to understand and makes sense of how Java works. I think anyone that has a child wanting to learn programming would want this and any other book this author writes as its easy to read and step by step instructions don't make you feel like you have to be a computer 'genius' to be able to do programming.
customer_reviews.author: Bekah Graham

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: The first part of this manual teaches you how to get the entire java setup in place, and you can do your first java program. As a beginner, I found it easy to understand the instructions and examples, following along on my own computer. Because there is so much more that can be done with java programming, I look forward to getting the others in the series by this knowledgeable author.
customer_reviews.author: Marakesh102

customer_reviews.title: What a great book. I knew almost nothing on the subject ...
customer_reviews.text: What a great book. I knew almost nothing on the subject before I picked it up and now I feel like I can go ahead and begin working on my own. I highly recommend this book for all beginners as a place to start. I've been in education for twenty years and I can tell you that this is a great book to school you through JAVA.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Mooney

customer_reviews.title: This book is the perfect introduction to learning Java
customer_reviews.text: This book is the perfect introduction to learning Java. It contains tons of useful information and makes it easy to learn the language. The author explains what Java is, the history, the features, and many other useful aspects as well. Recommend for Java both learners and beginners and anyone interested in learning more about the language.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Woo

customer_reviews.title: A quick and simple guide with easy steps!
customer_reviews.text: JAVA is used for many different devices, including mobile's. This book is great for anyone looking to learn the basics. It is well detailed and easy to understand. This book will have you using JAVA in no time. A quick and simple guide with easy steps! If learning JAVA is something that your interested in then check out this book.
customer_reviews.author: Enesha

customer_reviews.title: this book is a great starting point
customer_reviews.text: This handy guide is ideal for anyone interested in writing computer programs in Java. I knew nothing about Java when I downloaded this book, but I do now. In fact, I understand the basic principles of programs, how to start writing my own and the differences between variables and constants, to name just a few topic covered. This step-by-step guide includes diagrams and illustrations that clearly show each stage of the program writing process. If you plan to be a software developer or simply want to create your own applications, this book is a great starting point. Looking forward to the second book in the series.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helped me quickly
customer_reviews.text: I took programming classes for game development - levels 1 and 2. However, this was 2 years ago and I totally forgot most of it. This book brought me back up to speed over the weekend. Now I can get back to developing the game that I stopped working on 2 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: lotsakids

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Written
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend to anyone with a year or more of programming experience. Some concepts have incorrect explainations and I found several grammar errors. Better off looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Ault

customer_reviews.title: Informative Start
customer_reviews.text: The details in this beginner book were helpful and the explanations were clear. I came in knowing 0 about java and learned a lot about the beginning steps of programming.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This book dives right into java and starts teaching you the basics of the syntax. I highly recommend this book to people who are just getting started and at a great price it's a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great book.
customer_reviews.text: Great book for someone who is wanting to learn Java.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F.

customer_reviews.title: A good foundation
customer_reviews.text: Covering data types, variables, constants and operators, Programming Basics for Absolute Beginners is completely as advertised. Between the embedded download links to everything you’ll need to get started and the sample code provided, even the most novice programmer will be able to make simple Java programs using this book.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Benham

customer_reviews.title: Great Guide!
customer_reviews.text: As a student of computer science I bought this book to get a bit of extra information about the programming language Java. It really helped me to understand the matter much more and implement the gained Knowledge in my daily work. I can really recommend this book to anyone who is looking to get started with programming!
customer_reviews.author: Bilal

product_meta.title: Java: Programming Basics for Absolute Beginners (Step-By-Step Java Book 1)
